text: I cannot rest from travel; I will drink life to the lees
author: Alfred, Lord Tennyson

text: How dull it is to pause, to make an end, To rust unburnish'd, not to shine in use!
author: Alfred, Lord Tennyson

text:
Come, my friends,
'T is not too late to seek a newer world.
author: Alfred, Lord Tennyson

text:
Do I dare
Disturb the universe?
In a minute there is time
For decisions and revisions which a minute will reverse.
author: T.S. Eliot
source: The Love Song of J. Alfred Prufrock

text:
I grow old...I grow old...
I shall wear the bottoms of my trousers rolled.
author: T.S. Eliot
source: The Love Song of J. Alfred Prufrock

text: 'Everyone strives after the law,' says the man, 'so how is that in these many years no one except me has requested entry?' The gatekeeper sees that the man is already dying and, in order to reach his diminishing sense of hearing, he shouts at him, 'Here no one else can gain entry, since this entrance was assigned only to you.'
author: Franz Kafka

text: Look on every exit as being an entrance somewhere else.
author: Tom Stoppard

text: Be happy--if you're not even happy, what's so good about surviving?
author: Tom Stoppard

text:
And you may ask yourself
Well...How did I get here?
author: Talking Heads

text: And you may ask yourself What is that beautiful house? And you may ask yourself Where does that highway go to? And you may ask yourself Am I right? or Am I wrong?
author: Talking Heads

text:
This ain't no party, this ain't no disco, This ain't no fooling around
No time for dancing, or lovey dovey, I ain't got time for that now
author: Talking Heads

text:
These things seem small and undistinguishable,
Like far-off mountains turn'd into clouds.
author: William Shakespeare
